title: Site Continuous Improvement (I-Cube) Manager (m/w/d) - ISG Personalmanagement
subtitle: Villach, K 9500
body:
Our customer is a world market leader for special mineral solutions for industry. With the value adding conversion of natural resources and the development of synthetic minerals, our customer will develop solutions to improve the performance of numerous products in many markets. To lead cross-functional teams and to define & execute Continuous improvement program in order to improve site cost competitiveness and efficiency of processes, practices and organizations, our customer is looking for a

Site Continuous Improvement (I-Cube) Manager (m/f/d)

Location: Villach, Austria
Contract type: Permanen (Full-time)

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Deploy and sustain Continuous Industrial Improvement (I-Cube) program within the site & cultivate a strong continuous improvement culture across the hub
  • Support analysis of processes and practices to enable safety / efficiency / quality continuous improvement initiative generation
  • Generate detailed continuous improvement initiatives across the plant
  • Lead effective operational processes’ implementation at site level
  • Provide technical support and expertise to on-site teams for I-Cube deployment and improvement projects
  • Monitor progress of continuous improvement projects and related savings Maintain and create appropriate documentation for reports, project execution, and data analysis
  • Support operation sites & supply chain team members & consequently continuous improvement deployment
  • Operational costs reduction & Operational costs savings pipeline at site level
  • Customer satisfaction at site level

COMPETENCIES & EXPERIENCES

  • Engineer (or equivalent)
  • Excellent Level of German (C1+), Good level of English (B2+)
  • Min 2 years experience in Operations Management / Operational Excellence program management
  • Good continuous improvement culture and able to learn very fast methods
  • Strong analytical, project management, process management, problem-solving & technical skills
  • Ability to positively influence teams in a matrix organization
  • Able to organize training paths for managers of in the hubs
  • Green belt is a plus
Annual gross salary: collective agreement: chemical industry (classification III), with the willingness to overpay depending on professional qualifications and experience.

If you are interested in this challenging position we are looking forward to receiving your comprehensive application for ref.no.79.293 preferably through our ISG-Careerportal or via email.
